books.title: Scaramouche
books.author: Rafael Sabatini
books.summary: A country lawyer finds love and adventure as he seeks revenge during the French Revolution.

books.title: The Laughing Cavalier
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: An ancestor of the Scarlet Pimpernel is recruited to kidnap a woman for a few days.

books.title: The Story of My Life
books.author: Helen Keller
books.summary: Helen Keller writes about her experiences as a deafblind child learning to communicate.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Just So Stories
books.author: Rudyard Kipling
books.summary: A collection of short humorous fables for children, most purporting to tell the origin of animal characteristics such as the camel’s hump.

books.title: A Woman of No Importance
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A mother’s secretive past clashes with high society when her son is offered an irresistible position with a charismatic nobleman.

books.title: Heartbreak House
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Men and women of the English leisured classes gather at a country house on the eve of war to discuss love, life, and the future.

books.title: The Shaving of Shagpat
books.author: George Meredith
books.summary: A Persian barber embarks on a quest to save a city from the clutches of a tyrant and his magical hair.

books.title: The Vicar of Wakefield
books.author: Oliver Goldsmith
books.summary: A country vicar and his family are subjected to a series of unfortunate events.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.summary: An ancient undead monster terrorizes Victorian London.

books.title: Essays
books.author: Henry David Thoreau
books.summary: A collection of Henry David Thoreau’s essays.

books.title: The Benson Murder Case
books.author: S. S. Van Dine
books.summary: A Manhattanite art connoisseur becomes an amateur detective as he assists his good friend, the District Attorney, in solving an unusual murder case.

books.title: Yashka
books.author: Maria Bochkareva
books.summary: A Russian peasant leaves exile in Siberia to fight for her country in World War I.

books.title: A Voice from the South
books.author: Anna Julia Cooper
books.summary: A Black woman from the American South philosophizes on various subjects.

books.title: Hudibras
books.author: Samuel Butler
books.summary: A knight and his squire set forth for adventure and love.

books.title: Crome Yellow
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: A young writer travels to an English countryside manor to spend the summer alongside a cast of outlandish leisure class intellectuals.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Henry Kuttner
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Henry Kuttner, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: School Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s school stories about the lives and adventures of schoolboys in the early 1900s.

books.title: The Pilgrim Kamanita
books.author: Karl Gjellerup
books.summary: An Indian merchant’s son sets on a pilgrimage after a life of love, loss, business, and pleasure, and unknowingly relates his tale to the Buddha.

books.title: The Innocents Abroad
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain travels abroad, offering witty observations on the places and cultures he encounters and commentary on the habits and foibles of his fellow travelers.
